intro: Laplacea wrightii, commonly known as the Wright's laplacea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Laplacea wrightii is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
